Subject:  Security clearance to GHA operating at airport (s) in India.  
 
 
It is observed that number of cases for security clearance of 
“concessionaire   firm/ auxiliary service providers” are pending with BCAS/IB. 
This has happened due to consideration of all those firms also, which do not fall 
under the category of Ground Handling Agencies operating at the airports but 
have applied for their security clearance.  
 
2. 
It is clarified that only Ground Handling Agencies which are required to 
access the sensitive areas or services inside the airport and the aircrafts shall be 
subjected to IB clearance and others may be security cleared by concerned 
RDCOS(BCAS) on the basis of local police verification reports of the firm and 
their owners under intimation to BCAS HQ.  
 
3. 
Henceforth, all concerned should comply with the above directions. 
 
4. 
This issues with the approval of COS (CA).
